column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r18412013223\r\r1\r2232232112\r\r2\r233244233\r\r3\r243253234\r\r4\r24320132212\r\r5\r253283273\r\r6\r241323132213\r\rOther**\r131121\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement\r\rEachyear
column5: andsupportpersonnelbasedonstudent\rachievement data and staff self assessment. Professional learning activities are planned to address the school-wide focus and the identified areas of\rimprovement.\r\rProfessional learning activities for the 2018-19 school year include:\r•The ILT received training on how to implement school-wide Professional Learning Cycles to develop high-impact language strategies .\r•Teachers received training on teacher-student clarity and developed school-wide practices for success criteria.\r•Teachers meet in grade level and cross grade level groups to collaborate on instructional planning and the use of assessments to inform\rinstruction.\r•Teachers receive- Teachers received training on how to use Lexile Levels using Achieve3000 to monitor student progress in reading.\r•Teachers received training on Positive Behavior and Supports and conflict resolution through restorative practices.d training on restorative\rpractices.\r•Teachers participated in analysis of data including Lexile Levels
column8: and CAASPP interim assessments to plan instruction.\r•Instructional Leadership Team attended mathematics conference to develop professional capacity to effectively teach mathematics using\rthe Cognitively Guided Instruction framework.\r\rProfessional learning activities for the 2018-19 school year include:\r•The ILT structures the professional learning cycles for the staff to support the school-wide focus' of language arts.\r•Teachers meet in grade level and cross grade level groups to collaborate on instructional planning and the use of assessments to inform\rinstruction.\r•Teachers received training on how to use Lexile Levels using Achieve3000 to monitor student progress in reading.\r•Teachers received training on Positive Behavior and Supports and conflict resolution through restorative practices.\r•Teachers received training in GLAD (Guided Language Acquisition and Development) for mathematics.\r•Teachers received training in effective mathematics teaching practices at a school-cohort mathematics mini-conference.\r•Teachers received training on teacher-student clarity and on developed school-wide practices for learning intentions.\r•Teachers participated in analysis of data including CELDT
column10: and CAASPP interim assessments to plan instruction.\r\rProfessional learning activities for the 2017-18 school year include:\r•All teachersattenddistrict trainingsessionsonEnglishLanguageDevelopmentusingournewadoptionmaterials.Siteprofessional\rdevelopment focused on English Language Arts.\r•The ILT structured the professional learning opportunities for the staff to support the school-wide focus' of language arts.\r•Teachers participated in analysis of data including CELDT
